intro: Reholttumia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan reholttumia, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
